definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to close (a door)/to eclipse/muddled/stupid/ignorant/variant of 暗[an4]

sentences.english: If you have pain and numbness or if the color of the fingers turns pale or dark, come right away.
sentences.chinese: 如果手指疼和发麻或颜色发白或发暗，就马上来诊治。

sentences.english: They were in the saloon of a sinking ship, looking up at him through the darkening water.
sentences.chinese: 她们困在沉船客舱里，透过发暗的水体凝望他。

sentences.english: The room was darkening. he turned over towards the light and lay gazing into the glass paper weight.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里开始发暗，他转身凑着光亮，盯着玻璃镇纸看。

sentences.english: He turned over towards the light and lay gazing into the glass paperweight.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里开始发暗，他转身凑着光亮，盯着玻璃镇纸看。

definition: to turn pale/to lose color/to go white
dark spot or blotch on the skin
to be suffused with white/to be discolored/to blanch
